intro: Mesembryanthemum otzenianum, commonly known as the "Snowy Star" or "Cape Violet," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and fleshy stems adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often resembling miniature daisies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
